uncorrected, from the beginning to the end, Cause them so oft to require 
a wrong pronunciation till with your assistance they pronounce 
it truly, allowing for the naturall defects in the speech of sum 
Persons, the younger will learn these pronunciations more easily 
but the older may attain them also altho with more difficulty 
2 Suffer them at nohand in spelling to dismember any syllable 
by repeating the letters singly, but that they pronounce them who 
as they find them
Think not this method tedious the end will Crowne and reward
the Labor, and what the learner hath thus attained and habitua 
ted himself to, will remain with him all his lifetime 
This new primer will without Change except in the Title page 
be the same for all nations and Languages 
<s>End <\s>
<s>The Lords prayer in English in this new Carracter 

[new script]

the following page gives the Alphabet and Character 
mentioned in this discourse, with the Lords prayer in 
English written therein as a specimen.

by Fran. Lodwick 
see Tr: 182
